marketNews.title: MSCI Global Index Rebalancing: TPIA Enters, TOWR & SMGR Downgraded
marketNews.content:
Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) Indonesia announced a rebalancing of the MSCI Global Standard Index and the MSCI Small Cap Index. The changes will be effective at the close of 31 May 2024, with an effective date of 1 June 2024. Details are as follows:
- MSCI Global Standard Index
  - Added: TPIA
  - Removed: TOWR, SMGR
- MSCI Small Cap Index
  - Added: GGRM, MIKA, TOWR, SMGR, ULTJ
  - Removed: AUTO, BIPI, BBKP, BJBR, LPKR, ENRG, MNCN, CARE, LSIP
The constituents of the MSCI Micro Cap Index remain unchanged. MSCI will announce the next rebalancing on 12 August 2024, with an effective date of 2 September 2024.
Key Takeaway: Companies added to the MSCI indices are expected to receive inflows, potentially acting as a positive catalyst for their share prices. Following the announcement, the stocks that entered the MSCI indices closed higher on Wednesday (15/5), with TPIA up 8.31% and ULTJ up 3.45%. Conversely, stocks that were downgraded from the Global Standard Index to the Small Cap Index weakened on the same day, such as TOWR down 3.85% and SMGR down 2.37%.
Based on the trend in the last three rebalancings, stocks added to MSCI indices tend to appreciate, with an average increase of 12.4% from announcement to the effective date. In the same period, stocks removed from the MSCI indices experienced an average decline of 7.1%.

marketNews.title: U.S. President Joe Biden announces higher tariffs on Chinese imports
marketNews.content: U.S. President Joe Biden officially announced an increase in import tariffs on a range of products from China on Tuesday (14 May local time. Under the new regulation, the tariff on Chinese electric vehicles rises from 27.5% to 102.5% in 2024. In addition, tariffs on imported steel, aluminium and lithium-ion battery and critical minerals from China will increase from 7.5% to 25% in 2024. The BBC reported that several analysts consider the tariff hike largely symbolic and a move by President Biden to boost his electoral profile ahead of the election.

marketNews.title: Bank Mandiri chief economist projects 2024 bank credit growth of 9-10% YoY
marketNews.content: Chief Economist of Bank Mandiri, Andry Asmoro, projected that national bank credit growth in 2024 will be in the range of +9-10% year-on-year. The projection is lower than the Bank Indonesia target of +10-12% YoY but aligns with the OJK target of +9-11% YoY. Asmoro based his outlook on tight liquidity at big banks, a retreat in expectations of a BI Rate cut, a "wait and see" stance by entrepreneurs ahead of the cabinet announcement, and weakening purchasing power among lower-income households. For 2024, Bank Mandiri itself targets credit growth of +13-15% YoY.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's trade surplus narrows to $3.56 billion in April 2024
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Central Bureau of Statistics (BPS) reported that Indonesia's trade surplus fell to US$3.56 billion in April 2024 (versus US$3.94 billion in April 2023), still better than the consensus forecast of a US$3.3 billion surplus. Imports grew 1.72% YoY in April 2024 (versus a forecast of +4.57% YoY), marking the first growth in 11 months. Exports rose 4.62% YoY (versus a forecast of +8.69% YoY).

marketNews.title: Venture capital financing falls 10.18% YoY in March 2024
marketNews.content: Venture capital financing remains under pressure, with the Financial Services Authority (OJK) reporting that venture capital financing fell 10.18% YoY to IDR 16.79 trillion in March 2024. The total assets of venture capital firms also contracted 5.62% YoY to IDR 26.34 trillion. PT BNI Modal Ventura CEO Eddi Danusaputro said the decline in venture financing is caused by macro-economic turbulence, geopolitical tensions, and high interest rates.

marketNews.title: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada plans rights issue of ~2.2 billion new shares
marketNews.content: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada (CMNP) plans to conduct a rights issue of approximately 2.2 billion new shares, resulting in a dilution of up to 25%. The issue price and ratio have not been disclosed. Proceeds will be used for the development of the Ir. Wiyoto-Wiyono toll road, the Msc. toll road, and the construction of the Depok-Antasari section 3-4 toll road. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholdersâ€™ meeting on 20 June 2024.

tickerNews.title: ADRO declares final dividend of Rp218 per share, implied yield 7.7%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Adaro Energy Indonesia approved a final dividend for the 2023 financial year amounting to US$400 million, equivalent to IDR 218 per share based on an exchange rate of IDR 16,067 per US$1. The dividend is cum-dividend and the payment date has not been announced. Using the closing price of ADRO at IDR 2,830 on Wednesday (15/5), the implied dividend yield is 7.7%. Previously, ADRO also paid an interim dividend of US$400 million in January 2024.

tickerNews.title: ADMR targets up to US$250 million capex and 5.5-6.5 Mt metallurgical coal in 2024
tickerNews.content: Adaro Minerals Indonesia (ADMR) plans a capital expenditure of US$175-250 million in 2024 for an aluminium smelter and to increase metallurgical coal production capacity. In 2024, ADMR targets metallurgical coal output to grow 7.8-27.5% YoY to 5.5-6.5 million tonnes, while coal sales are targeted to rise 8.9-20% YoY to 4.9-5.4 million tonnes. Director Wito Krisnahadi said the aluminium smelter will start operating in 3Q25 with an initial production capacity of 500,000 tonnes of aluminium ingot per year, and the company has signed a sales memorandum of understanding with two aluminium buyers.

tickerNews.title: ABMM declares final dividend of IDR 295 per share, implied yield 8%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of ABM Investama approved a final dividend for the 2023 financial year of approximately IDR 812.2 billion, or IDR 295 per share. The dividend is cum-dividend and the payment date has not been announced. Using the closing price of ABMM at IDR 3,700 on Wednesday (15/5), the implied dividend yield is 8%.

tickerNews.title: ELSA declares 2023 dividend of IDR 27.6 per share, implied yield 6.3%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Elnusa (ELSA) approved a 2023 dividend of IDR 201.3 billion, or about IDR 27.6 per share. The dividend is cum-dividend and the payment date has not been announced. Using the closing price of ELSA at IDR 440 on Wednesday (15/5), the implied dividend yield is 6.3%.

tickerNews.title: INTP announces 2023 dividend of IDR 90 per share, implied yield 1.3%
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) will distribute a 2023 dividend of approximately IDR 308.8 billion, or IDR 90 per share. The dividend is cum-dividend in the regular market and in the negotiation window on 22 May 2024, with payment on 14 June 2024. Using the closing price of INTP at IDR 6,625 on Wednesday (15/5), the implied dividend yield is 1.3%. The payout ratio for the 2023 dividend fell to 15.83% (versus 30% in 2022) as capital expenditure exceeded the budget, as detailed in a Stockbit commentary.

tickerNews.title: DRMA begins export of wiring harnesses to Hyundai and KIA, plans new plant
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal (DRMA) subsidiary PT Dharma Kyungshin Indonesia began its first export of wiring harnesses for Hyundai and KIA to the United States. Director General Irianto Santoso said the total value of the export shipment reached US$15.8 million in 2024 and is projected to reach US$26.8 million in 2025. DRMAâ€™s ownership in PT Dharma Kyungshin Indonesia is only 49% as of 1Q24, so the earnings are not consolidated. In addition, DRMA will build a new plant worth IDR 200 billion in Cirebon, West Java, targeting operation in May 2025.

tickerNews.title: HILL (CMNP) announces
tickerNews.content: Hillcon (HILL) will distribute a 2023 dividend of approximately IDR 103.2 billion, or IDR 35 per share. The dividend is cum-dividend in the regular market and in the negotiation window on 20 May 2024, with payment on 11 June 2024. Using the closing price of HILL at IDR 3,130 on Wednesday (15/5), the implied dividend yield is 1.1%.
